paper_abstract: In this paper it is shown that Winograd's algorithm for computing convolutions and a fast, prime factor, discrete Fourier transform (DFT) algorithm can be modified to compute Fourier-like transforms of long sequences of 2(m) - 1 points over GF(2(m)), for 8 <= in <= 10. These new transform techniques can be used to decode Reed-Solomon (RS) codes of block length 2(m) - 1. The complexity of this new transform algorithm is reduced substantially from more conventional methods. A computer simulation verifies these new results. (c) 2004 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Fast, prime factor, discrete Fourier transform algorithms over GF(2(m)) for 8 <=, m <= 10
